meanings.sent1: The ticket was transferable, so I could give it to my friend.
meanings.sent2: The contract stated that the ownership of the car was transferable to the new owner.
meanings.sent3: The transferable coupon made everyone in the store laugh.
meanings.sent4: Her skills were so transferable that she excelled in every new job she tried.
meanings.sent5: The concept of time zones is easily transferable to understanding different time differences.

meanings.definition: Capable of being moved or passed from one person to another.
meanings.sent1: The transferable skills of the employee made them valuable to multiple departments.
meanings.sent2: The gift card was transferable, allowing the recipient to share it with a friend.
meanings.sent3: The transferable nature of the rumor caused quite a stir in the office.
meanings.sent4: Her infectious laughter was as transferable as a yawn in a quiet room.
meanings.sent5: The joy of music is easily transferable from one person to another through shared playlists.

meanings.definition: Relating to the ability to transfer something.
meanings.sent1: The transferable fee for the service was clearly outlined in the contract.
meanings.sent2: The transferable nature of the data allowed for seamless sharing between devices.
meanings.sent3: The transferable concept of teamwork was demonstrated through a group project.
meanings.sent4: Her leadership skills were as transferable as a well-traveled suitcase.
meanings.sent5: The idea of kindness is easily transferable across different cultures and languages.
